title: 'Burned alive': At least 48 killed in Nigeria after fuel tanker collides with truck
content: A devastating collision between a fuel tanker and another truck in Nigeria's Niger state resulted in an explosion that killed at least 48 people and 50 animals. Emergency services discovered additional victims burned beyond recognition. Governor Mohammed Bago urged residents to stay calm and stressed the importance of following traffic regulations to avoid future tragedies.
summary: A devastating collision between a fuel tanker and another truck in Nigeria's Niger state resulted in an explosion that killed at least 48 people and 50 animals. Emergency services discovered additional victims burned beyond recognition. Governor Mohammed Bago urged residents to stay calm and stressed the importance of following traffic regulations to avoid future tragedies.

title: Melania Trump speaks about 2020 election: 'Efforts to silence my husband'
content: Melania Trump released a teaser video for her upcoming memoir, noting how the 2020 election changed their lives, affecting food prices and free speech. This comes amid speculation about her absence from Donald Trump's campaign and Scaramucci's recent claim that Melania wants Kamala Harris to win the election more than anyone else.
summary: Melania Trump released a teaser video for her upcoming memoir, noting how the 2020 election changed their lives, affecting food prices and free speech. This comes amid speculation about her absence from Donald Trump's campaign and Scaramucci's recent claim that Melania wants Kamala Harris to win the election more than anyone else.

title: Bangladesh to take steps to get Hasina extradited to face genocide trial
content: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal will begin proceedings to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India on genocide charges related to a student-led uprising that toppled her government. Chief prosecutor Mohammad Tajul Islam, associated with Jamaat-e-Islami, highlighted the critical need to safeguard evidence for these trials.
summary: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal will begin proceedings to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India on genocide charges related to a student-led uprising that toppled her government. Chief prosecutor Mohammad Tajul Islam, associated with Jamaat-e-Islami, highlighted the critical need to safeguard evidence for these trials.

title: Maduro's challenger Gonzalez flees Venezuela, seeks asylum in Spain
content: Edmundo Gonzalez, former Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate, has fled to Spain after receiving asylum. The Venezuelan government facilitated his departure following an arrest warrant to restore political peace. Spain will grant him political asylum, and he plans to continue campaigning against the regime from abroad.
summary: Edmundo Gonzalez, former Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate, has fled to Spain after receiving asylum. The Venezuelan government facilitated his departure following an arrest warrant to restore political peace. Spain will grant him political asylum, and he plans to continue campaigning against the regime from abroad.

title: Popular Hawaii hiking trail shut after 37 fall sick in 'rare' norovirus outbreak
content: The Kalalau Trail on Kauai island in Hawaii has been shut down following reports of over three dozen hikers contracting norovirus. Health officials are evaluating the risk and disinfecting the trail, which will remain closed until at least September 19. Norovirus spreads easily through contaminated surfaces and causes gastrointestinal issues.
summary: The Kalalau Trail on Kauai island in Hawaii has been shut down following reports of over three dozen hikers contracting norovirus. Health officials are evaluating the risk and disinfecting the trail, which will remain closed until at least September 19. Norovirus spreads easily through contaminated surfaces and causes gastrointestinal issues.

title: Evidence against Imran points towards military trial: Pak's defence min
content: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has suggested that evidence against former prime minister Imran Khan indicates a military trial for his alleged involvement in the May 9 violence. Khan has sought to prevent this through a petition in the Islamabad High Court, which faced procedural objections from the court.
summary: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has suggested that evidence against former prime minister Imran Khan indicates a military trial for his alleged involvement in the May 9 violence. Khan has sought to prevent this through a petition in the Islamabad High Court, which faced procedural objections from the court.

title: Imran Khan's party stage rally in Islamabad; demand his immediate release
content: Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf organized a significant rally near Islamabad, calling for his release and denouncing the government's crackdown. Thousands participated despite obstacles. PTI leaders committed to continuous protests until Khan is released and planned additional rallies nationwide. New legislation now penalizes unauthorized gatherings in Islamabad.
summary: Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf organized a significant rally near Islamabad, calling for his release and denouncing the government's crackdown. Thousands participated despite obstacles. PTI leaders committed to continuous protests until Khan is released and planned additional rallies nationwide. New legislation now penalizes unauthorized gatherings in Islamabad.

title: Bangladesh interim govt warns against communal unrest during Durga puja
content: Bangladesh's interim government has issued a stern warning against any disruptions during Durga puja, set for October 9 to 13. They pledge strict action against troublemakers and have engaged local communities and madrasa students for temple security. This follows recent violence targeting Hindus after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation.
summary: Bangladesh's interim government has issued a stern warning against any disruptions during Durga puja, set for October 9 to 13. They pledge strict action against troublemakers and have engaged local communities and madrasa students for temple security. This follows recent violence targeting Hindus after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation.

title: Bangladesh-India ties must be based on fairness and equity, says Yunus
content: Interim government chief adviser Muhammad Yunus emphasized the need for equitable and fair relations with India during a meeting with students involved in the recent revolution. He highlighted mutual respect and regional cooperation through SAARC. Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser expressed surprise at Indian defense minister Rajnath Singh's comments on potential conflicts.
summary: Interim government chief adviser Muhammad Yunus emphasized the need for equitable and fair relations with India during a meeting with students involved in the recent revolution. He highlighted mutual respect and regional cooperation through SAARC. Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser expressed surprise at Indian defense minister Rajnath Singh's comments on potential conflicts.

title: Two NATO members say Russian drones violated their airspace
content: Two NATO members reported Russian drones violating their airspace; one entered Romania and another crashed in Latvia. Romania deployed F-16 jets and issued alerts to residents. Ukraine faced deadly airstrikes with civilian casualties. German Chancellor Scholz stated that future peace talks would involve Russia and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy.
summary: Two NATO members reported Russian drones violating their airspace; one entered Romania and another crashed in Latvia. Romania deployed F-16 jets and issued alerts to residents. Ukraine faced deadly airstrikes with civilian casualties. German Chancellor Scholz stated that future peace talks would involve Russia and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy.

title: Kamala Harris says her grandfather was part of India's Independence movement. Social media asks 'how'
content: Vice president Kamala Harris Sunday reminisced about her Indian roots and said when she used to visit her grandparents, her grandfather used to take her on morning walks and then discuss the importance of fighting for equality and fighting corruption. In her post made on the occasion of the National Grandparents Day, Kamala Harris included an old family photo and claimed that her grandfather had been a part of the movement to win India's independence.
summary: Vice president Kamala Harris Sunday reminisced about her Indian roots and said when she used to visit her grandparents, her grandfather used to take her on morning walks and then discuss the importance of fighting for equality and fighting corruption. In her post made on the occasion of the National Grandparents Day, Kamala Harris included an old family photo and claimed that her grandfather had been a part of the movement to win India's independence.

title: Russia advances in east Ukraine, launches deadly air strikes
content: Russia has made advances in eastern Ukraine amid intensified aerial attacks from both sides. Kyiv urges Western allies to permit more retaliatory strikes inside Russia after Russian drones breached NATO airspace. Moscow focuses on capturing the Donbas region, achieving significant territorial gains recently. Kyiv seeks longer-range missiles from the West.
summary: Russia has made advances in eastern Ukraine amid intensified aerial attacks from both sides. Kyiv urges Western allies to permit more retaliatory strikes inside Russia after Russian drones breached NATO airspace. Moscow focuses on capturing the Donbas region, achieving significant territorial gains recently. Kyiv seeks longer-range missiles from the West.

title: Meghan Markle may fly to UK for Christmas but on invitation from Princess Diana's family
content: Harry and Meghan were not there in last year's Christmas celebration of the Royal Family. They were also excluded from the summer summit this year. But Harry and Meghan's relationship with Diana's family remains intact and Harry visited Althorp House during his UK trip last week to attend the memorial service of Lord Robert Fellowes, Diana's brother-in-law.
summary: Harry and Meghan were not there in last year's Christmas celebration of the Royal Family. They were also excluded from the summer summit this year. But Harry and Meghan's relationship with Diana's family remains intact and Harry visited Althorp House during his UK trip last week to attend the memorial service of Lord Robert Fellowes, Diana's brother-in-law.

title: Trump and Harris neck-and-neck in NYT/Sienna poll: 'Voters don't know enough about her'
content: A new NYT/Sienna poll shows Donald Trump leading Kamala Harris by a slim margin, with Trump at 48% and Harris at 47%. This makes the upcoming debate crucial for Harris, as many voters still seek more information about her. Trump's support remains strong despite recent difficulties after a month of Democrats' enthusiasm over Kamala Harris' candidacy.
summary: A new NYT/Sienna poll shows Donald Trump leading Kamala Harris by a slim margin, with Trump at 48% and Harris at 47%. This makes the upcoming debate crucial for Harris, as many voters still seek more information about her. Trump's support remains strong despite recent difficulties after a month of Democrats' enthusiasm over Kamala Harris' candidacy.

title: 'Always the nasty man': Did Donald Trump mock Kamala Harris' height?
content: Donald Trump is around 6'2'' or 6'3'' (weight around 215 pounds/97.5 kg). Kamala Harris' height has some confusion as records claim that the vice president is 5'2'' but in an interview, Kamala said it was not true. "I am 5'4'' and a quarter -- something 5/4'' and a half. With heels, which I always wear, I', 5'7'' and a half," Kamala said. So even with heels, Kamala Harris will appear much shorter than Donald Trump.
summary: Donald Trump is around 6'2'' or 6'3'' (weight around 215 pounds/97.5 kg). Kamala Harris' height has some confusion as records claim that the vice president is 5'2'' but in an interview, Kamala said it was not true. "I am 5'4'' and a quarter -- something 5/4'' and a half. With heels, which I always wear, I', 5'7'' and a half," Kamala said. So even with heels, Kamala Harris will appear much shorter than Donald Trump.

title: Kamala Harris will be on right side of screen in debate with Trump. Like Biden was
content: Kamala Harris-Donald Trump debate: A coin flip was done on Tuesday which Trump won and got the privilege of choosing either podium placement or closing statement order. Trump chose to speak last and have Harris the podium placement. Kamala Harris will be on the right side of the screen, but left on the podium.
summary: Kamala Harris-Donald Trump debate: A coin flip was done on Tuesday which Trump won and got the privilege of choosing either podium placement or closing statement order. Trump chose to speak last and have Harris the podium placement. Kamala Harris will be on the right side of the screen, but left on the podium.

title: China expands foreign access, plans to allow foreign-owned hospitals in key urban centers
content: China is set to allow wholly foreign-owned hospitals in nine regions, including Beijing and Shanghai, to attract foreign investment and improve healthcare quality. The policy excludes traditional Chinese medicine hospitals and bars foreign mergers with public hospitals. Guidelines for establishing these hospitals will be released soon.
summary: China is set to allow wholly foreign-owned hospitals in nine regions, including Beijing and Shanghai, to attract foreign investment and improve healthcare quality. The policy excludes traditional Chinese medicine hospitals and bars foreign mergers with public hospitals. Guidelines for establishing these hospitals will be released soon.

title: George Bush won't endorse either Kamala Harris or Trump because...
content: It's no secret that Bush and Trump do not go along well and Trump built his political career partly by trashing the legacy of the Bush dynasty. Bush stopped endorsing anyone in the presidential election as Trump entered the race in 2016 but he never spoke against Trump. At a recent speech, when the November election was still between Trump and Biden, long-retired Bush said he was younger than both the candidates and yet too old.
summary: It's no secret that Bush and Trump do not go along well and Trump built his political career partly by trashing the legacy of the Bush dynasty. Bush stopped endorsing anyone in the presidential election as Trump entered the race in 2016 but he never spoke against Trump. At a recent speech, when the November election was still between Trump and Biden, long-retired Bush said he was younger than both the candidates and yet too old.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan likely to face military trial, says defence minister Khawaja Asif
content: Pakistan's defence minister, Khawaja Asif, revealed that former Prime Minister Imran Khan could face a military trial due to mounting legal issues. Detained in Adiala Jail, Khan has filed a petition to halt the trial. The Supreme Court's recent ruling on military trials and ongoing legal debates complicate his situation further.
summary: Pakistan's defence minister, Khawaja Asif, revealed that former Prime Minister Imran Khan could face a military trial due to mounting legal issues. Detained in Adiala Jail, Khan has filed a petition to halt the trial. The Supreme Court's recent ruling on military trials and ongoing legal debates complicate his situation further.

title: Watch: Man steals tow truck, damages multiple cars in Brooklyn
content: An enraged man in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, stole a tow truck after seeing his vehicle being towed. Following a physical altercation with the tow truck driver, he drove recklessly, damaging several cars and crashing into a city bus. The man abandoned the truck and fled on foot. Authorities are actively searching for him.
summary: An enraged man in Sunset Park, Brooklyn, stole a tow truck after seeing his vehicle being towed. Following a physical altercation with the tow truck driver, he drove recklessly, damaging several cars and crashing into a city bus. The man abandoned the truck and fled on foot. Authorities are actively searching for him.
